org.tinfour.demo.viewer.backplane

Class MvComposite

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tinfour.demo.viewer.backplane.MvComposite

  • public class MvComposite
extends Object
    Provides elements and method for managing the imagery associated with a model and a set of view options.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MvComposite(IModel model, ViewOptions view, int width, int height, AffineTransform m2c, AffineTransform c2m, int taskIndex)
      Construct an instance with the specified rendering elements.
      MvComposite(MvComposite mvComposite, ViewOptions view, boolean preserveTins, int taskIndex)
      Construct a new composite transferring data products from the older composite so that they may be reused without additional processing.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MvComposite

        public MvComposite(IModel model,
                   ViewOptions view,
                   int width,
                   int height,
                   AffineTransform m2c,
                   AffineTransform c2m,
                   int taskIndex)
        Construct an instance with the specified rendering elements. Note that once instantiated, the model and view must never be changed.
        Parameters:
        model - a valid instance giving a data source
        view - a valid specification giving instructions on how the data is to be rendered
        width - the width of the panel rendering surface
        height - the height of the panel rendering surface
        m2c - the model to composite transformation; specify a null for first time initialization
        c2m - the composite to model transformation; specify a null for first time initialization
        taskIndex - the index of the task used during the initialization of this instance

      • MvComposite

        public MvComposite(MvComposite mvComposite,
                   ViewOptions view,
                   boolean preserveTins,
                   int taskIndex)
        Construct a new composite transferring data products from the older composite so that they may be reused without additional processing. These elements may include TINs and grids as well as transformations. Generally, this method is used when the styling has changed, but the geometry has not.
        Parameters:
        mvComposite - the older composite
        view - a valid set of view parameters
        preserveTins - preserve TIN elements from previous composite
        taskIndex - the index for the task associated with the composite

    • Method Detail

      • getModel

        public IModel getModel()
        Get the model associated with composite.
        Returns:
        a valid instance

      • getView

        public ViewOptions getView()
        Get the view options associated with the composite. It is important that application code not alter the content of the options object/
        Returns:
        a valid view object.

      • getTaskIndex

        public int getTaskIndex()
        Get the index of the task currently associated with the composite.
        Returns:
        a positive integer

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Get the width of the composite
        Returns:
        a positive integer in pixels

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Get the height of the composite
        Returns:
        a positive integer value in pixels

      • setWireframeTin

        public void setWireframeTin(org.tinfour.common.IIncrementalTin tin,
                            int reduction)
        Sets the TIN to be used for wireframe rendering. Important: the TIN must not be modified after it is added to this composite.
        Parameters:
        tin - a valid TIN.
        reduction - the reduction factor applied when building the TIN

      • getComposite2ModelTransform

        public AffineTransform getComposite2ModelTransform()
        Get the transform that maps the composite to the model
        Returns:
        a valid instance

      • getModel2CompositeTransform

        public AffineTransform getModel2CompositeTransform()
        Get a transform that maps the model to the composite
        Returns:
        a valid instance

      • getModelDataStringAtCoordinates

        public String getModelDataStringAtCoordinates(double x,
                                              double y)
        Map the specified composite coordinates to the model and get a string indicating the data at that point. Typically called to support mouse move events.
        Parameters:
        x - a coordinate in the composite coordinate system
        y - a coordinate in the composite coordinate system
        Returns:
        a valid string

      • performQuery

        public MvQueryResult performQuery(double x,
                                  double y)
        Maps the specified composite coordinates to the model, performs a data query, and gets an HTML-formatted string indicating the data at that point.
        Parameters:
        x - a coordinate in the composite coordinate system
        y - a coordinate in the composite coordinate system
        Returns:
        a valid string

      • isModelReloadRequired

        public boolean isModelReloadRequired(ViewOptions v)
        Indicates whether a change in view options would require reloading the existing model.
        Parameters:
        v - a set of view options for comparison
        Returns:
        true if the comparison options are incompatible and require a reloading of the model.

      • getModelAndRenderingReport

        public String getModelAndRenderingReport()

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()

      • renderLegend

        public BufferedImage renderLegend(ViewOptions vx,
                                  IModel mx,
                                  int width,
                                  int height,
                                  int margin,
                                  Font font,
                                  boolean frame)
        Render a legend for the current model and view. The width and height are the dimensions of the color bar, but the actual legend will extend larger to accommodate labels.
        Parameters:
        vx - a valid view
        mx - a valid model
        width - the width of the color bar
        height - the height of the color bar
        margin - the margin around the overall legend
        font - the font to be used for labeling (if enabled)
        frame - indicates that a framing rectangle is to be drawn around the legend
        Returns:
        if successful, a valid buffered image; otherwise, a null

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • setConstraintsForRender

        public void setConstraintsForRender(List<org.tinfour.common.IConstraint> constraintsForRender)
        Sets the constraints for rendering. These are often not the constraints from the model but a reduced-resolution version.
        Parameters:
        constraintsForRender - a potentially empty list of constraints

        public List<org.tinfour.common.IConstraint> getConstraintsForRender()
